definitions.definition: Sure in one's mind, positive ; absolutely confident in the truth of something.
examples: I was certain of my decision.

definitions.definition: Not to be doubted or denied ; established as a fact .
examples: Now that more experiments have been run, the theory is certain and the argument is settled.
It is certain that Spain will reach the finals. / Spain is now certain to reach the finals. / Spain is now certain of a place in the finals.
Bankruptcy is the certain outcome of your constant gambling and lending.

definitions.definition: Particular and definite , but unspecified or unnamed ; used to introduce someone or something without going into further detail .
examples: Every wine has a certain distinctive character which sets it apart from all others.
Each morning, she would see a certain man rush past her window on his way to work.

definitions.definition: Used to denote that the speaker is referring to a specific person or thing that they do not want to name directly, implying that the listener should infer the identity of the referent.
examples: I would have been here on time, but a certain someone lost the car keys!
Looking inside the cover, they learned that the book had once belonged to a certain R. Jones.

definitions.definition: Used before the name of someone famous that people are expected to know.
examples: Since the last British government to make such a proposal was that of a certain Margaret Thatcher, it might not seem unreasonable.

main_definition: Sure in one's mind, positive ; absolutely confident in the truth of something.
secondary_definitions: Not to be doubted or denied ; established as a fact .
Particular and definite , but unspecified or unnamed ; used to introduce someone or something without going into further detail .

( euphemistic , preceded by "a" ) Used to denote that the speaker is referring to a specific person or thing that they do not want to name directly, implying that the listener should infer the identity of the referent.
( preceded by "a" , of a person ) Named but not previously mentioned .
( preceded by "a" , of a person ) Used before the name of someone famous that people are expected to know.
